  • IoCConfiguration_Overview.xml

IoCConfiguration_Overview.xmlÂ¶

The file IoCConfiguration_Overview.xml provides an overview of various features of IoC.Configuration

This configuration file can be downloaded downloaded from IoCConfiguration_Overview.xml.

   1<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
   2
   3<!--This is a demo IoC.Configuration file. Even though this configuration file, along with tests in folder SuccessfulConfigurationLoadTests
   4  covers many use cases, some concepts are covered in more details in separate configuration files and tests.
   5  Here is the list of other configuration files and tests that cover specific use cases:
   6
   7  Type reuse, generic types and arrays (elements typeDefinitions and typeDefinition and referencing types defined under typeDefinitions
   8        element using attributes like typeRef, interfaceRef, classRef, etc): Look at configuration file
   9        IoCConfiguration_GenericTypesAndTypeReUse.xml and tests in folder GenericTypesAndTypeReUse.
  10  Element autoService: look at configuration file IoCConfiguration_autoService.xml and tests in folder AutoService.
  11  Element autoServiceCustom: look at configuration file IoCConfiguration_autoServiceCustom.xml and tests in folder AutoService.
  12  Element collection: look at configuration file IoCConfiguration_collection.xml and tests in folder Collection.
  13  Element classMember and _classMember: prefix in "if" elements under autoMethod elements: look at configuration file
  14            IoCConfiguration_classMember.xml and tests in folder ClassMember.
  15  Element settingValue: look at configuration file IoCConfiguration_settingValue_ReferencingInConfiguration.xml and tests in folder SettingValue.
  16  Element constructedValue: look at configuration file IoCConfiguration_constructedValue.xml and tests in folder ConstructedValue.
  17  Element proxyService: look at configuration file IoCConfiguration_proxyService.xml and tests in folder ProxyService.
  18
  19  Element valueImplementation (to provide implementation as a value). Example is using a classMember, or settingValue elements to
  20     provide an implementation for a service.: look at configuration file IoCConfiguration_valueImplementation.xml and tests in folder ValueImplementation.
  21-->
  22<!--
  23   The XML configuration file is validated against schema file IoC.Configuration.Schema.7579ADB2-0FBD-4210-A8CA-EE4B4646DB3F.xsd,
  24   which can be found in folder IoC.Configuration.Content in output directory.
  25   The schema file can also be downloaded from
  26   http://oroptimizer.com/ioc.configuration/V2/IoC.Configuration.Schema.7579ADB2-0FBD-4210-A8CA-EE4B4646DB3F.xsd or in source code
  27   project in Github.com.
  28
  29   To use Visual Studio code completion based on schema contents, right click Properties on this file in Visual Studio, and in Schemas
  30   field pick the schema IoC.Configuration.Schema.7579ADB2-0FBD-4210-A8CA-EE4B4646DB3F.xsd.
  31
  32   Before running the tests make sure to execute IoC.Configuration\Tests\IoC.Configuration.Tests\PostBuildCommands.bat to copy the dlls into
  33   folders specified in this configuration file.
  34   Also, modify the batch file to copy the Autofac and Ninject assemblies from Nuget packages folder on machine, where the test is run.
  35-->
  36
  37<iocConfiguration
  38     xmlns:xsi='http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance'
  39     xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://oroptimizer.com/IoC.Configuration/V2/IoC.Configuration.Schema.7579ADB2-0FBD-4210-A8CA-EE4B4646DB3F.xsd">
  40
  41     <!--The application should have write permissions to path specified in appDataDir.
  42    This is where dynamically generated DLLs are saved.-->
  43     <!--NOTE: path should be an absolute path, or should be converted to absolute path by some implementation of
  44     IoC.Configuration.AttributeValueTransformer.IAttributeValueTransformer. In this example the paths are converted by
  45     IoC.Configuration.Tests.FileFolderPathAttributeValueTransformer.-->
  46     <appDataDir
  47             path="TestFiles\AutogeneratedDlls\IoCConfiguration_Overview" />
  48
  49     <plugins pluginsDirPath="TestFiles\PluginDlls">
  50
  51             <!--
  52        Plugin assemblies will be in a folder with similar name under pluginsDirPath folder.
  53        The plugin folders will be included in assembly resolution mechanism.
  54        -->
  55
  56             <!--A folder K:\...\IoC.Configuration\Tests\IoC.Configuration.Tests\bin\TestFiles\PluginDlls\Plugin1 should exist.  -->
  57             <plugin name="Plugin1" />
  58             <plugin name="Plugin2" />
  59             <plugin name="Plugin3" enabled="false" />
  60     </plugins>
  61
  62     <additionalAssemblyProbingPaths>
  63             <probingPath
  64                     path="TestFiles\ThirdPartyLibs" />
  65             <probingPath
  66                     path="TestFiles\ContainerImplementations\Autofac" />
  67             <probingPath
  68                     path="TestFiles\ContainerImplementations\Ninject" />
  69
  70             <probingPath
  71                     path="TestFiles\DynamicallyLoadedDlls" />
  72             <probingPath
  73                     path="TestFiles\TestAssemblyResolution" />
  74     </additionalAssemblyProbingPaths>
  75
  76     <assemblies>
  77             <!--Assemblies should be in one of the following locations:
  78        1) Executable's folder
  79        2) In folder specified in additionalAssemblyProbingPaths element.
  80        3) In one of the plugin folders specified in plugins element (only for assemblies with plugin attribute) -->
  81             <assembly name="OROptimizer.Shared" alias="oroptimizer_shared" />
  82             <assembly name="IoC.Configuration" alias="ioc_config" />
  83             <assembly name="IoC.Configuration.Autofac" alias="autofac_ext" />
  84             <assembly name="IoC.Configuration.Ninject" alias="ninject_ext" />
  85
  86             <assembly name="TestProjects.Modules" alias="modules" />
  87
  88             <!--
  89        Use "overrideDirectory" attribute, to make the assembly path explicit, rather then searching for
  90        an assembly in predefined folders, which also include
  91        probing paths specified in additionalAssemblyProbingPaths element.
  92        -->
  93             <assembly name="TestProjects.DynamicallyLoadedAssembly1"
  94                               alias="dynamic1" overrideDirectory="TestFiles\DynamicallyLoadedDlls"/>
  95
  96             <assembly name="TestProjects.DynamicallyLoadedAssembly2"
  97                       alias="dynamic2" />
  98
  99             <assembly name="TestProjects.TestPluginAssembly1"
 100                               alias="pluginassm1" plugin="Plugin1" />
 101
 102             <assembly name="TestProjects.ModulesForPlugin1"
 103                               alias="modules_plugin1" plugin="Plugin1" />
 104
 105             <assembly name="TestProjects.Plugin1WebApiControllers"
 106                               alias="plugin1api" plugin="Plugin1" />
 107
 108
 109             <assembly name="TestProjects.TestPluginAssembly2"
 110                               alias="pluginassm2" plugin="Plugin2" />
 111
 112             <assembly name="TestProjects.ModulesForPlugin2"
 113                               alias="modules_plugin2" plugin="Plugin2"/>
 114
 115             <assembly name="TestProjects.TestPluginAssembly3"
 116                               alias="pluginassm3" plugin="Plugin3" />
 117
 118             <assembly name="TestProjects.SharedServices" alias="shared_services" />
 119
 120             <assembly name="IoC.Configuration.Tests" alias="tests" />
 121     </assemblies>
 122
 123     <typeDefinitions>
 124             <!--For more examples of type definitions and generic types, arrays, and re-using types defined under
 125             typeDefinition element look at file IoCConfiguration_GenericTypesAndTypeReUse.xml, as well as tests
 126             in folder GenericTypesAndTypeReUse.
 127             -->
 128             <typeDefinition alias="ReadOnlyListOf_IInterface1" type="System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList[SharedServices.Interfaces.IInterface1]" />
 129
 130             <!--The type definition below is similar to C# type System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<SharedServices.Interfaces.IInterface1[]>-->
 131             <typeDefinition alias="enumerableOfArray" type="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable[SharedServices.Interfaces.IInterface1#]" />
 132
 133             <!--The type definition below is similar to C# type System.Collections.Generic.IList<SharedServices.Interfaces.IInterface1[]>-->
 134             <typeDefinition alias="listOfArray" type="System.Collections.Generic.IList" >
 135                     <genericTypeParameters>
 136                             <typeDefinition type="SharedServices.Interfaces.IInterface1#" />
 137                     </genericTypeParameters>
 138             </typeDefinition>
 139
 140             <typeDefinition alias="AutoService_IInterface1" type="IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IInterface1" />
 141             <typeDefinition alias="IActionValidator" type="SharedServices.Interfaces.IActionValidator" />
 142             <typeDefinition alias="IProjectGuids" type="IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IProjectGuids" />
 143             <typeDefinition alias="ActionTypes" type="SharedServices.DataContracts.ActionTypes" />
 144             <typeDefinition alias="Guid" type="System.Guid" />
 145             <typeDefinition alias="ListOfInt" type="System.Collections.Generic.List[System.Int32]" >
 146             </typeDefinition>
 147     </typeDefinitions>
 148
 149     <!--assembly attribute is not required, and only is needed to make sure the type is looked at specific assembly
 150    If the assembly attribute is omitted, the type will be looked in all assemblies specified in assemblies, plus some additional
 151    assemblies such as OROptimizer.Shared, IoC.Configuration, etc.
 152     -->
 153     <parameterSerializers serializerAggregatorType="OROptimizer.Serializer.TypeBasedSimpleSerializerAggregator"
 154                                               assembly="oroptimizer_shared">
 155             <!--
 156        Use parameters element to specify constructor parameters, if the type specified in 'serializerAggregatorType' attribute
 157        has non-default constructor.
 158        -->
 159             <!--<parameters>
 160        </parameters>-->
 161             <serializers>
 162                     <parameterSerializer type="OROptimizer.Serializer.TypeBasedSimpleSerializerDouble" />
 163                     <parameterSerializer type="OROptimizer.Serializer.TypeBasedSimpleSerializerLong" />
 164                     <parameterSerializer type="OROptimizer.Serializer.TypeBasedSimpleSerializerInt"/>
 165                     <parameterSerializer type="OROptimizer.Serializer.TypeBasedSimpleSerializerShort"/>
 166                     <parameterSerializer type="OROptimizer.Serializer.TypeBasedSimpleSerializerByte" />
 167                     <parameterSerializer type="OROptimizer.Serializer.TypeBasedSimpleSerializerBoolean" />
 168                     <parameterSerializer type="OROptimizer.Serializer.TypeBasedSimpleSerializerDateTime" />
 169                     <parameterSerializer type="OROptimizer.Serializer.TypeBasedSimpleSerializerString" />
 170                     <parameterSerializer type="TestPluginAssembly1.Implementations.DoorSerializer" />
 171                     <parameterSerializer type="TestPluginAssembly2.Implementations.WheelSerializer" />
 172
 173                     <parameterSerializer type="TestPluginAssembly1.Implementations.UnsignedIntSerializerWithParameters" >
 174                             <parameters>
 175                                     <int32 name="param1" value="25" />
 176                                     <double name="param2" value="36.5" />
 177                             </parameters>
 178                     </parameterSerializer>
 179             </serializers>
 180
 181     </parameterSerializers>
 182
 183     <!--The value of type attribute should be a type that implements
 184    IoC.Configuration.DiContainer.IDiManager-->
 185     <diManagers activeDiManagerName="Autofac">
 186             <diManager name="Ninject" type="IoC.Configuration.Ninject.NinjectDiManager">
 187                     <!--
 188            Use parameters element to specify constructor parameters,
 189            if the type specified in 'type' attribute has non-default constructor.
 190            -->
 191                     <!--<parameters>
 192            </parameters>-->
 193             </diManager>
 194
 195             <diManager name="Autofac" type="IoC.Configuration.Autofac.AutofacDiManager">
 196             </diManager>
 197     </diManagers>
 198
 199     <!--
 200    If settingsRequestor element is used, the type in type attribute should
 201    specify a type that implements IoC.Configuration.ISettingsRequestor.
 202    The implementation specifies a collection of required settings that should be present
 203    in settings element.
 204    Note, the type specified in type attribute is fully integrated into a dependency
 205    injection framework. In other words, constructor parameters will be injected using
 206    bindings specified in dependencyInjection element.
 207    -->
 208     <settingsRequestor type="SharedServices.FakeSettingsRequestor">
 209     </settingsRequestor>
 210
 211     <settings>
 212             <int32 name="SynchronizerFrequencyInMilliseconds" value="5000"  />
 213             <double name="MaxCharge" value="155.7" />
 214             <string name="DisplayValue" value="Some display value" />
 215
 216             <!--NOTE: For more comprehensive examples for constructedValue element,
 217        look at file IoCConfiguration_constructedValue.xml and tests in folder ConstructedValue.-->
 218             <constructedValue name="DefaultDBConnection" type="SharedServices.Implementations.SqliteDbConnection">
 219                     <parameters>
 220                             <string name="filePath" value="c:\SQLiteFiles\MySqliteDb.sqlite"/>
 221                     </parameters>
 222             </constructedValue>
 223
 224             <object name="Project1Guid" typeRef="Guid" value="EA91B230-3FF8-43FA-978B-3261493D58A3" />
 225             <object name="Project2Guid" typeRef="Guid" value="9EDC7F1A-6BD6-4277-9015-5A9277218681" />
 226
 227             <constructedValue name="Interface11_Value" type="SharedServices.Implementations.Interface11_Impl1">
 228                     <parameters>
 229                             <!-- Constructor parameter of  SharedServices.Implementations.Interface11 is injected using a constructedValue element-->
 230                             <constructedValue name="param1" type="SharedServices.Implementations.Interface10_Impl1" >
 231                                     <parameters>
 232                                             <int32 name="param1" value="13" />
 233                                     </parameters>
 234                                     <injectedProperties>
 235                                             <string name="Property2" value="Value 1"/>
 236                                     </injectedProperties>
 237                             </constructedValue>
 238                     </parameters>
 239
 240                     <injectedProperties>
 241                             <!-- Property SharedServices.Implementations.Interface11.Property2 is injected using a constructedValue element-->
 242                             <constructedValue name="Property2" type="SharedServices.Implementations.Interface10_Impl1" >
 243                                     <parameters>
 244                                             <int32 name="param1" value="17"/>
 245                                     </parameters>
 246                                     <injectedProperties>
 247                                             <string name="Property2" value="Value 2"/>
 248                                     </injectedProperties>
 249                             </constructedValue>
 250
 251                     </injectedProperties>
 252             </constructedValue>
 253
 254             <!--NOTE: For more comprehensive examples for collection element,
 255        look at file IoCConfiguration_collection.xml and tests in folder Collection.-->
 256             <constructedValue name="Collections" type="IoC.Configuration.Tests.Collection.Services.DemoCollectionInjection">
 257                     <parameters>
 258                             <!--Demo of injecting a collection into a constructor of DemoCollectionInjection in constructedValue element.-->
 259                             <collection name="intValues" collectionType="readOnlyList" itemType="System.Int32">
 260                                     <int32 value="17"/>
 261                                     <int32 value="14"/>
 262                             </collection>
 263                     </parameters>
 264                     <injectedProperties>
 265                             <!--Demo of injecting a collection into a property of DemoCollectionInjection in constructedValue element.-->
 266                             <collection name="Texts" collectionType="readOnlyList" itemType="System.String">
 267                                     <string value="ABC, Inc"/>
 268                                     <string value="Microsoft"/>
 269                             </collection>
 270                     </injectedProperties>
 271             </constructedValue>
 272
 273             <boolean name="failCustomServiceValidation" value="false"/>
 274     </settings>

 276     <!--
 277      webApi is an optional element that contains ASP.NET Core related
 278      sections such as assemblies with API controllers, etc
 279    -->
 280     <webApi>
 281             <controllerAssemblies>
 282                     <!--
 283                     Specify assemblies with API controllers.
 284                     The user of IoC.Configuration should add the assemblies to MVC using
 285                     IMvcBuilder.AddApplicationPart(System.Reflection.Assembly)
 286                     -->
 287                     <controllerAssembly assembly="dynamic1"></controllerAssembly>
 288             </controllerAssemblies>
 289     </webApi>

 291     <dependencyInjection>
 292             <modules>
 293                     <module type="IoC.Configuration.Tests.PrimitiveTypeDefaultBindingsModule" >
 294                             <parameters>
 295                                     <!--Date time can be also long value for ticks. For example the datetime value below can
 296                                     be replaced with 604096704000000000-->
 297                                     <datetime name="defaultDateTime" value="1915-04-24 00:00:00.000" />
 298                                     <double name="defaultDouble" value="0" />
 299                                     <int16 name="defaultInt16" value="0" />
 300                                     <classMember name="defaultInt32" class="System.Int32" memberName="MinValue"/>
 301                             </parameters>
 302                     </module>
 303
 304                     <!--Type Modules.Autofac.AutofacModule1 is an Autofac module and is a
 305                                            subclass of Autofac.AutofacModule-->
 306                     <module type="Modules.Autofac.AutofacModule1" >
 307                             <parameters>
 308                                     <int32 name="param1" value="1" />
 309                             </parameters>
 310                     </module>
 311
 312                     <!--Type Modules.IoC.DiModule1 is an IoC.Configuration module and is a subclass
 313                of IoC.Configuration.DiContainer.ModuleAbstr-->
 314                     <module type="Modules.IoC.DiModule1" >
 315                             <parameters>
 316                                     <int32 name="param1" value="2" />
 317                             </parameters>
 318                     </module>
 319
 320                     <!--Type Modules.Ninject.NinjectModule1 is a Ninject module and is a
 321            subclass of Ninject.Modules.NinjectModule-->
 322                     <module type="Modules.Ninject.NinjectModule1" >
 323                             <parameters>
 324                                     <int32 name="param1" value="3" />
 325                             </parameters>
 326                     </module>
 327
 328                     <module type="IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.AutoServiceTestsModule" />
 329             </modules>
 330             <services>
 331                     <service type="DynamicallyLoadedAssembly1.Interfaces.IInterface1">
 332                             <implementation type="DynamicallyLoadedAssembly1.Implementations.Interface1_Impl1"
 333                                                             scope="singleton">
 334                             </implementation>
 335                     </service>
 336
 337                     <service type="DynamicallyLoadedAssembly1.Interfaces.IInterface2">
 338                             <implementation type="DynamicallyLoadedAssembly1.Implementations.Interface2_Impl1"
 339                                                             scope="transient">
 340                             </implementation>
 341                     </service>
 342
 343                     <service type="DynamicallyLoadedAssembly1.Interfaces.IInterface3">
 344                             <implementation type="DynamicallyLoadedAssembly1.Implementations.Interface3_Impl1"
 345                                                             scope="scopeLifetime">
 346                             </implementation>
 347                     </service>
 348
 349                     <!--
 350            Test DI picking the default constructor when instantiating the implementation, if parameters element is
 351            present, and using non-default constructor otherwise, with injected parameters.
 352            -->
 353                     <service type="SharedServices.Interfaces.IInterface9">
 354                             <implementation type="SharedServices.Implementations.Interface9_Impl1"
 355                                                             scope="singleton" />
 356                     </service>
 357                     <service type="SharedServices.Interfaces.IInterface8">
 358                             <implementation type="SharedServices.Implementations.Interface8_Impl1"
 359                                                             scope="singleton">
 360                                     <!--
 361                    Since parameters is present, a default constructor will be used to construct an object, even though
 362                    Interface8_Impl1 has also a non default constructor.
 363                    -->
 364                                     <parameters>
 365                                     </parameters>
 366                             </implementation>
 367
 368                             <implementation type="SharedServices.Implementations.Interface8_Impl2" scope="singleton">
 369                                     <!--
 370                    Since parameters is not present, DI will pick a constructor with maximum number of parameters.
 371                    Note, Interface8_Impl2 has two constructors, a default one, and a constructor with parameters.
 372                    -->
 373                             </implementation>
 374                     </service>
 375
 376                     <!--Injected constructor parameters with self bound services-->
 377                     <selfBoundService type="DynamicallyLoadedAssembly1.Implementations.SelfBoundService1"
 378                                                       scope="singleton">
 379                             <parameters>
 380                                     <int32 name="param1" value="14" />
 381                                     <double name="param2" value="15.3" />
 382                                     <injectedObject name="param3" type="DynamicallyLoadedAssembly1.Interfaces.IInterface1" />
 383                             </parameters>
 384                     </selfBoundService>
 385
 386                     <!--Injected properties with self bound services-->
 387                     <selfBoundService type="DynamicallyLoadedAssembly1.Implementations.SelfBoundService2"
 388                                                       scope="transient">
 389                             <injectedProperties>
 390                                     <int32 name="Property1" value="17" />
 391                                     <double name="Property2" value="18.1" />
 392                                     <injectedObject name="Property3" type="DynamicallyLoadedAssembly1.Interfaces.IInterface1" />
 393                             </injectedProperties>
 394                     </selfBoundService>
 395
 396                     <!--Life time scope with self bound services-->
 397                     <selfBoundService type="DynamicallyLoadedAssembly1.Implementations.SelfBoundService3"
 398                                                       scope="scopeLifetime">
 399                     </selfBoundService>
 400
 401                     <!--Test circular references between SharedServices.Interfaces.IInterface3 and SharedServices.Interfaces.IInterface4-->
 402                     <service type="SharedServices.Interfaces.IInterface3" >
 403                             <implementation type="SharedServices.Implementations.Interface3_Impl1"
 404                                                             scope="singleton">
 405                                     <injectedProperties>
 406                                             <injectedObject name="Property2" type="SharedServices.Interfaces.IInterface4" />
 407                                     </injectedProperties>
 408                             </implementation>
 409                     </service>
 410                     <service type="SharedServices.Interfaces.IInterface4">
 411                             <implementation type="SharedServices.Implementations.Interface4_Impl1"
 412                                                             scope="singleton">
 413                             </implementation>
 414                     </service>
 415
 416                     <!--Injected constructor parameters-->
 417                     <service type="SharedServices.Interfaces.IInterface2" >
 418                             <!--Test constructor parameters-->
 419                             <implementation type="SharedServices.Implementations.Interface2_Impl1"
 420                                                             scope="singleton">
 421                                     <parameters>
 422                                             <!--The value will be de-serialized using serializer TypeBasedSimpleSerializerDateTime
 423                        in parameterSerializers section.-->
 424                                             <datetime name="param1" value="2014-10-29 23:59:59.099" />
 425                                             <double name="param2" value="125.1" />
 426                                             <injectedObject name="param3" type="SharedServices.Interfaces.IInterface3" />
 427                                     </parameters>
 428                             </implementation>
 429
 430                             <!--Test injected properties-->
 431                             <implementation type="SharedServices.Implementations.Interface2_Impl2"
 432                                                             scope="singleton">
 433                                     <injectedProperties>
 434                                             <!--The value of param2 will be de-serialized using serializer TypeBasedSimpleSerializerDateTime
 435                        in parameterSerializers section.-->
 436                                             <datetime name="Property1" value="1915-04-24 00:00:00.001" />
 437                                             <double name="Property2" value="365.41" />
 438                                             <injectedObject name="Property3" type="SharedServices.Interfaces.IInterface3" />
 439                                     </injectedProperties>
 440                             </implementation>
 441
 442                             <!--Test constructor parameters with injected properties. Constructor values will be overridden by
 443                injected properties.-->
 444                             <implementation type="SharedServices.Implementations.Interface2_Impl3"
 445                                                             scope="singleton">
 446                                     <parameters>
 447                                             <!--The value will be de-serialized using serializer TypeBasedSimpleSerializerDateTime in
 448                        parameterSerializers section.-->
 449                                             <datetime name="param1" value="2017-10-29 23:59:59.099" />
 450                                             <double name="param2" value="138.3" />
 451
 452                                             <!--
 453                        Inject specific implementation. Note, there is no binding for Interface3_Impl2.
 454                        IoC.Configuration** will automatically register a self bound service for a type specified in elements
 455                        injectedObject, if the type is not an abstract type or an interface, and if it is not already
 456                        registered in configuration file.
 457                        Also, using injectedObject, we can specify a type other than a type registered for interface
 458                        SharedServices.Implementations.Interface3 (i.e., the type of parameter param3).
 459                        In other words, no matter what bindings are specified for interface SharedServices.Implementations.Interface3,
 460                        the object injected for parameter param3 will be of type SharedServices.Implementations.Interface3_Impl2.
 461                        -->
 462                                             <injectedObject name="param3" type="SharedServices.Implementations.Interface3_Impl2" />
 463                                     </parameters>
 464                                     <injectedProperties>
 465                                             <double name="Property2" value="148.3" />
 466                                             <!--
 467                        Inject specific implementation. Note, there is no binding for Interface3_Impl3.
 468                        IoC.Configuration** will automatically register a self bound service for a type specified in element
 469                        injectedObject, if the type is not an abstract type or an interface, and if it is not already
 470                        registered in configuration file.
 471                        Also, using injectedObject, we can specify a type other than a type registered for type of property
 472                        Property3 somewhere else. By using element injectedObject we explicitly state the type of the object
 473                        that should be injected, which is SharedServices.Implementations.Interface3_Impl3 in this example.
 474                        -->
 475                                             <injectedObject name="Property3" type="SharedServices.Implementations.Interface3_Impl3" />
 476                                     </injectedProperties>
 477                             </implementation>
 478
 479                             <!--Test injected constructor parameters. Primitive type constructor parameters, such as DateTime and double,
 480                    will be injected with default values specified in module: IoC.Configuration.Tests.PrimitiveTypeDefaultBindingsModule.
 481                 -->
 482                             <implementation type="SharedServices.Implementations.Interface2_Impl4"
 483                                                             scope="singleton">
 484                             </implementation>
 485                     </service>
 486
 487                     <!--Test constructed values to set implementation constructor parameter and property values-->
 488                     <service type="SharedServices.Interfaces.Airplane.IAirplane" >
 489                             <implementation type="SharedServices.Implementations.Airplane.Airplane" scope="singleton" >
 490                                     <parameters>
 491                                             <!--Tested constructed value in parameter-->
 492                                             <constructedValue name="engine" type="SharedServices.Implementations.Airplane.AirplaneEngine">
 493                                                     <parameters>
 494                                                             <!--Constructed value parameters can also be constructed values. However, for simplicity, injected parameters were used -->
 495                                                             <injectedObject name="blade" type="SharedServices.Interfaces.Airplane.IAirplaneEngineBlade" />
 496                                                             <injectedObject name="rotor" type="SharedServices.Interfaces.Airplane.IAirplaneEngineRotor" />
 497                                                     </parameters>
 498                                                     <!--constructedValue element also can have injectedProperties child element to inject values into constructed object
 499              properties which have public setters.-->
 500                                                     <!--<injectedProperties></injectedProperties>-->
 501                                             </constructedValue>
 502
 503                                     </parameters>
 504                             </implementation>
 505
 506                             <!--Tested constructed value to inject property values-->
 507                             <implementation type="SharedServices.Implementations.Airplane.Airplane" scope="singleton">
 508
 509                                     <injectedProperties>
 510                                             <!--Injecting constructed value of type SharedServices.Implementations.Airplane.AirplaneEngine
 511                                             into a property SharedServices.Implementations.Airplane.Airplane.Engine-->
 512                                             <constructedValue name="Engine" type="SharedServices.Implementations.Airplane.AirplaneEngine">
 513                                                     <!--Class TestProjects.SharedServices.Implementations.Airplane.AirplaneEngine has a default constructor
 514                                                     which will be used in this case.-->
 515
 516
 517                                                     <!--After the object is created, the values of properties AirplaneEngine.Blade and AirplaneEngine.Rotor will
 518                                                     be injected using injectedProperties element.-->
 519                                                     <injectedProperties>
 520
 521                                                             <!--Constructed value parameters can also be constructed values. However, for simplicity, injected parameters were used -->
 522                                                             <injectedObject name="Blade" type="SharedServices.Interfaces.Airplane.IAirplaneEngineBlade" />
 523                                                             <injectedObject name="Rotor" type="SharedServices.Interfaces.Airplane.IAirplaneEngineRotor" />
 524                                                     </injectedProperties>
 525                                             </constructedValue>
 526                                     </injectedProperties>
 527                             </implementation>
 528                     </service>

 530                     <service type="SharedServices.Interfaces.Airplane.IAirplaneEngineBlade">

 654
 655                     <!--NOTE: For more comprehensive examples for proxyService element,
 656                     look at file IoCConfiguration_proxyService.xml and tests in folder ProxyService.-->
 657                     <!--
 658                     Using proxyService we can configure binding of a parent interface IActionValidatorFactoryBase in such a way, that it is resolved
 659                     using the same binding set up for extending interface IActionValidatorFactory.
 660                     For example auto-generated service IActionValidatorFactory implements methods and properties in both IActionValidatorFactory
 661                     as well as in parent interface IActionValidatorFactoryBase. By using proxyService we can inject the auto-generated implementation
 662                     for IActionValidatorFactory into classes which depend on its parent interface IActionValidatorFactoryBase.
 663                     -->
 664                     <proxyService type="IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IActionValidatorFactoryBase">
 665                             <serviceToProxy type="IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IActionValidatorFactory"/>
 666                     </proxyService>
 667
 668                     <!--START-Test binding an interface to the ame instance to which a self-bound class is bound-->
 669                     <selfBoundService type="SharedServices.Implementations.Interface13_Impl1" scope="singleton" />
 670
 671                     <!--NOTE: Using proxyService allows us to bind
 672            SharedServices.Interfaces.IInterface13 to the same instance of SharedServices.Implementations.Interface13_Impl1 to which
 673            SharedServices.Implementations.Interface13_Impl1 was bound using selfBoundService element.
 674
 675            If we used "implementation" element under service and specified a type SharedServices.Implementations.Interface13_Impl1
 676            instead of using "proxyService", then SharedServices.Interfaces.IInterface13 would have been
 677            bound to a different instance of SharedServices.Implementations.Interface13_Impl1. In other words resolving
 678            SharedServices.Implementations.Interface13_Impl1 and SharedServices.Interfaces.IInterface13 would have resulted in
 679            different instances of SharedServices.Implementations.Interface13_Impl1.
 680            Using "proxyService" element might be useful when we have module(s) that scan assemblies and self-binds
 681            non-abstract classes. In this cases we can use "proxyService" element if we want the interface
 682            specified in "proxyService" element to resolve to exactly the same value to which the self bound class is bound.
 683            -->
 684                     <proxyService type="SharedServices.Interfaces.IInterface13">
 685                             <serviceToProxy type="SharedServices.Implementations.Interface13_Impl1"/>
 686                     </proxyService>
 687
 688                     <service type="SharedServices.Interfaces.IInterface14">
 689                             <implementation type="SharedServices.Implementations.Interface14_Impl1" scope="singleton" />
 690                     </service>
 691
 692                     <!--END-Test binding an interface to the ame instance to which a self-bound class is bound-->
 693
 694                     <!--Note, ActionValidatorsUser constructor has a parameter of type
 695                     IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IActionValidatorFactoryBase.
 696                     Since there is a proxyService element mapping the service IActionValidatorFactoryBase to IActionValidatorFactory,
 697                     an instance of auto-generated service IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IActionValidatorFactory will be injected.
 698                     -->
 699                     <selfBoundService type="IoC.Configuration.Tests.ProxyService.Services.ActionValidatorsUser" scope="singleton">
 700                     </selfBoundService>
 701
 702                     <!--System.Collections.Generic.List<System.Int32> will be bound to a list of three integers: 19, 2, 17-->
 703                     <service typeRef="ListOfInt">
 704                             <valueImplementation scope="singleton">
 705                                     <collection>
 706                                             <int32 value="19"/>
 707                                             <int32 value="2"/>
 708                                             <int32 value="17"/>
 709                                     </collection>
 710                             </valueImplementation>
 711                     </service>
 712
 713                     <!--Resolving System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Int32> will return the same value as resolving
 714            System.Collections.Generic.List<System.Int32>-->
 715                     <proxyService type="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable[System.Int32]">
 716                             <serviceToProxy typeRef="ListOfInt"/>
 717                     </proxyService>
 718
 719                     <!--Resolving System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList<System.Int32> will return the same value as resolving
 720            System.Collections.Generic.List<System.Int32>-->
 721                     <proxyService type="System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList[System.Int32]">
 722                             <serviceToProxy typeRef="ListOfInt"/>
 723                     </proxyService>
 724
 725                     <!--Resolving System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Int32> will return the same value as resolving
 726            System.Collections.Generic.List<System.Int32>-->
 727                     <proxyService type="System.Collections.Generic.IList[System.Int32]">
 728                             <serviceToProxy typeRef="ListOfInt"/>
 729                     </proxyService>
 730
 731                     <!--
 732                     Demo of classMember element to use static or non-static variables, properties and result of a call to parameterless
 733                     method to generate value used in configuration file.
 734                     NOTE: For more comprehensive examples for classMember element and "_classMember:" prefix in attributes in "if" elements in
 735                     autoService element, look at file IoCConfiguration_classMember.xml and tests in folder ClassMember.
 736                     -->
 737                     <service type="System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList[IoC.Configuration.Tests.ClassMember.Services.IAppInfo]">
 738                             <valueImplementation scope="singleton">
 739                                     <collection>
 740                                             <constructedValue type="IoC.Configuration.Tests.ClassMember.Services.AppInfo">
 741                                                     <parameters>
 742                                                             <!--We inject the constant value IoC.Configuration.Tests.ClassMember.Services.ConstAndStaticAppIds.AppId1
 743                                                             into constructor of AppInfo for parameter appId.
 744                                                             We can also use non constant static variables, as well as static properties and parameterless methods.
 745                                                             -->
 746                                                             <classMember name="appId"
 747                                                                                      class="IoC.Configuration.Tests.ClassMember.Services.ConstAndStaticAppIds"
 748                                                                                      memberName="AppId1"/>
 749                                                     </parameters>
 750                                             </constructedValue>
 751                                             <constructedValue type="IoC.Configuration.Tests.ClassMember.Services.AppInfo">
 752                                                     <injectedProperties>
 753                                                             <!--Since SharedServices.Implementations.SelfBoundService1.IntValue is a non-static property,
 754                                                             an instance of SharedServices.Implementations.SelfBoundService1 will be resolved from the DI container,
 755                                                             and the value of IntValue of resolved instance will be injected into property AppInfo.AppId.
 756                                                             Note, we can also use parameterless methods.
 757                                                             Also, if the class in class attribute is non-interface, non-abstract, and has a public constructor,
 758                                                             IoC.Configuration will generated a binding for that class, if one is not specified in configuration file
 759                                                             or IoC.Configuration modules.
 760                                                             -->
 761                                                             <classMember name="AppId"  class="SharedServices.Implementations.SelfBoundService1"
 762                                                                                      memberName="IntValue"/>
 763                                                     </injectedProperties>
 764                                             </constructedValue>
 765
 766                                             <constructedValue type="IoC.Configuration.Tests.ClassMember.Services.AppInfo">
 767                                                     <parameters>
 768                                                             <!--The enum value IoC.Configuration.Tests.ClassMember.Services.AppTypes.App1 is injected into constructor of
 769                                                             AppInfo for parameter appId-->
 770                                                             <classMember name="appId"
 771                                                                                      class="IoC.Configuration.Tests.ClassMember.Services.AppTypes"
 772                                                                                      memberName="App1"/>
 773                                                     </parameters>
 774                                             </constructedValue>
 775
 776                                             <!--
 777                                             An example of calling a non static factory method to create an instance of IAppInfo.
 778                                             Since method IoC.Configuration.Tests.ClassMember.Services.IAppInfoFactory.CreateAppInfo(appId, appDescription)
 779                                             is non-static, an instance of IAppInfoFactory will be resolved using the DI container.
 780                                             Also, since IAppInfoFactory is an interface, a binding for IAppInfoFactory should be configured in configuration
 781                                             file or in some module.
 782                                             -->
 783                                             <classMember class="IoC.Configuration.Tests.ClassMember.Services.IAppInfoFactory" memberName="CreateAppInfo">
 784                                                     <parameters>
 785                                                             <int32 name="appId" value="1258"/>
 786                                                             <string name="appDescription" value="App info created with non-static method call."/>
 787                                                     </parameters>
 788                                             </classMember>
 789
 790                                             <!--
 791                                             An example of calling a static factory method to create an instance of IAppInfo.
 792                                             -->
 793                                             <classMember class="IoC.Configuration.Tests.ClassMember.Services.StaticAppInfoFactory" memberName="CreateAppInfo">
 794                                                     <parameters>
 795                                                             <int32 name="appId" value="1259"/>
 796                                                             <string name="appDescription" value="App info created with static method call."/>
 797                                                     </parameters>
 798                                             </classMember>
 799                                     </collection>
 800                             </valueImplementation>
 801                     </service>
 802

 804                             <implementation type="IoC.Configuration.Tests.ClassMember.Services.AppInfoFactory" scope="singleton"/>
 805                     </service>

 840                     <!--Demo of referencing auto-implemented method parameters using parameterValue element-->
 841                     <autoService interface="IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IAppInfoFactory">
 842                             <autoMethod name="CreateAppInfo" returnType="IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IAppInfo">
 843                                     <methodSignature>
 844                                             <int32 paramName="appId"/>
 845                                             <string paramName="appDescription"/>
 846                                     </methodSignature>

 848                                     <default>
 849                                             <constructedValue type="IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.AppInfo">
 850                                                     <parameters>
 851                                                             <!--The value of name attribute is the name of constructor parameter in AppInfo-->
 852                                                             <!--
 853                                                             The value of paramName attribute is the name of parameter in IAppInfoFactory.CreateAppInfo.
 854                                                             This parameter should be present under autoMethod/methodSignature element.
 855                                                             -->
 856                                                             <!--In this example the values of name and paramName are similar, however they don't
 857                                                             have to be.-->
 858                                                             <parameterValue name="appId" paramName="appId" />
 859                                                             <parameterValue name="appDescription" paramName="appDescription" />
 860                                                     </parameters>
 861                                             </constructedValue>
 862                                     </default>
 863                             </autoMethod>
 864                     </autoService>

1010                                                     <!--We can also call a method or property in auto-generated interface, or in one of its base interfaces.-->
1011                                                     <classMember class="IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IActionValidatorFactory" memberName="DefaultActionValidator"/>
1012                                                     <injectedObject type="SharedServices.Implementations.ActionValidator3" />
1013                                                     <injectedObject type="DynamicallyLoadedAssembly2.ActionValidator4"/>
1014                                             </collection>
1015                                     </default>
1016                             </autoMethod>
1017
1018                             <!--Overloaded method GetValidators uses parameters of types System.Int2 and System.string, instead of
1019                             SharedServices.DataContracts.ActionTypes and System.Guid, as in case above.-->
1020                             <autoMethod name="GetValidators"
1021                                                     returnType="System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList[SharedServices.Interfaces.IActionValidator]">
1022                                     <methodSignature>
1023                                             <!--paramName attribute is optional, however it makes the auto-implementation more readable. -->
1024                                             <int32 paramName="actionTypeId"/>
1025                                             <string paramName="projectGuid" />
1026                                     </methodSignature>
1027
1028                                     <!-- Attributes parameter1 and parameter2 map values of parameters param1 and param2 in GetInstances() method to returned values. -->
1029                                     <if parameter1="0" parameter2="8663708F-C707-47E1-AEDC-2CD9291AD4CB">
1030                                             <collection>
1031                                                     <injectedObject type="SharedServices.Implementations.ActionValidator3" />
1032                                                     <injectedObject type="IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.ActionValidator4" />
1033                                             </collection>
1034                                     </if>
1035
1036                                     <default>
1037                                             <collection>
1038                                                     <!--We can also call a method or property in auto-generated interface, or in one of its base interfaces.-->
1039                                                     <classMember class="IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IActionValidatorFactory"
1040                                                                              memberName="DefaultActionValidator"/>
1041                                                     <injectedObject type="SharedServices.Implementations.ActionValidator3" />
1042                                                     <classMember class="IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.StaticAndConstMembers"
1043                                                                              memberName="GetDefaultActionValidator" />
1044                                                     <classMember class="IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IActionValidatorValuesProvider"
1045                                                                              memberName="AdminLevelActionValidator"/>
1046                                             </collection>
1047                                     </default>
1048                             </autoMethod>
1049
1050                     <!--Note, interface IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IActionValidatorFactory also has a method
1051                     void SomeMethodThatWillNotBeImplemented(int param1, string param2) and a property int SomeUnImplementedProperty { get; },'
1052                     we chose not to implement in configuration file. Unimplemented methods and properties will be auto-implemented to return default values,
1053                     based on return type defaults.
1054                     -->
1055                     </autoService>
1056
1057                     <!--IMemberAmbiguityDemo demonstrates cases when there are multiple occurrences
1058                     of auto-generated methods and properties with same signatures and return types
1059                     in IMemberAmbiguityDemo and its base interfaces.
1060                     -->
1061                     <autoService interface="IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IMemberAmbiguityDemo">
1062                             <!--GetIntValues(): IReadOnlyList<int> GetIntValues(int param1, string param2)-->
1063                             <autoMethod name="GetIntValues" returnType="System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList[System.Int32]" >
1064                                     <methodSignature>
1065                                             <int32 paramName="param1"/>
1066                                             <string paramName="param2"/>
1067                                     </methodSignature>
1068                                     <if parameter1="1" parameter2="str1">
1069                                             <collection>
1070                                                     <int32 value="17"/>
1071                                             </collection>
1072                                     </if>
1073                                     <default>
1074                                             <collection>
1075                                                     <int32 value="18"/>
1076                                                     <int32 value="19"/>
1077                                             </collection>
1078                                     </default>
1079                             </autoMethod>
1080
1081                             <!--
1082                             This method is declared in IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent3, which is a base interface for IMemberAmbiguityDemo.
1083                             We can provide implementation for this interface, even though it has a similar signature and return type as the method
1084                             method IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IMemberAmbiguityDemo.GetIntValues.
1085                             By using the attribute 'declaringInterface', we make a distinction between these two.
1086                             -->
1087                             <autoMethod name="GetIntValues" returnType="System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList[System.Int32]"
1088                                                     declaringInterface="IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent3">
1089                                     <methodSignature>
1090                                             <int32 paramName="param1"/>
1091                                             <string paramName="param2"/>
1092                                     </methodSignature>
1093                                     <default>
1094                                             <collection>
1095                                                     <int32 value="3"/>
1096                                             </collection>
1097                                     </default>
1098                             </autoMethod>
1099
1100                             <!---
1101                             The method GetDbConnection(System.Guid appGuid) that return IDbConnection is in two base interfaces
1102                             of IMemberAmbiguityDemo: in IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent1 and in
1103                             IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent2.
1104                             Therefore, to avoid ambiguity, we have to specify the declaring interface in attribute 'declaringInterface'.
1105                             We can specify an implementation for IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent2.GetDbConnection(),
1106                             and IoC.Configuration will generate a similar auto-implementation for the similar method in IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent1
1107                             as well.
1108                             -->
1109                             <autoMethod name="GetDbConnection" returnType="SharedServices.Interfaces.IDbConnection"
1110                                                     declaringInterface="IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent2">
1111                                     <methodSignature>
1112                                             <object paramName="appGuid" type="System.Guid"/>
1113                                     </methodSignature>
1114                                     <default>
1115                                             <constructedValue type="SharedServices.Implementations.SqliteDbConnection">
1116                                                     <parameters>
1117                                                             <string name="filePath" value="c:\mySqliteDatabase.sqlite"/>
1118                                                     </parameters>
1119                                             </constructedValue>
1120                                     </default>
1121                             </autoMethod>
1122
1123                             <!--
1124                             Both IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent1 and IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent2 have properties called DefaultDbConnection
1125                             with the same return types. We can auto-implement this property for each of these interfaces by using
1126                             declaringInterface attribute in autoProperty element to explicitly specify the interface that own
1127                             the property (declaringInterface can be used in autoMethod as well as demonstrated above)
1128                             -->
1129                             <!--Auto-implementation of IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent1.DefaultDbConnection-->
1130                             <autoProperty name="DefaultDbConnection" returnType="SharedServices.Interfaces.IDbConnection"
1131                                                       declaringInterface="IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent1">
1132                                     <constructedValue type="SharedServices.Implementations.SqliteDbConnection">
1133                                             <parameters>
1134                                                     <string name="filePath" value="c:\IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent1_Db.sqlite"/>
1135                                             </parameters>
1136                                     </constructedValue>
1137                             </autoProperty>
1138
1139                             <!--Auto-implementation of IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent2.DefaultDbConnection-->
1140                             <autoProperty name="DefaultDbConnection" returnType="SharedServices.Interfaces.IDbConnection"
1141                                                       declaringInterface="IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent2">
1142                                     <constructedValue type="SharedServices.Implementations.SqliteDbConnection">
1143                                             <parameters>
1144                                                     <string name="filePath" value="c:\IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent2_Db.sqlite"/>
1145                                             </parameters>
1146                                     </constructedValue>
1147                             </autoProperty>
1148
1149                             <!--
1150                             Method GetNumericValue() occurs in both IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent2
1151                             and IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent1_Parent. However, since the return types
1152                             are different (System.Double in IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent2, and System.Int32 in IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent1_Parent),
1153                             we can auto-implement both them, without using attribute 'declaringInterface' to separate these two implementation.
1154                             -->
1155                             <!--IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent2.GetNumericValue() with return type of System.Double-->
1156                             <autoMethod name="GetNumericValue" returnType="System.Double" >
1157                                     <default>
1158                                             <double value="17.3"/>
1159                                     </default>
1160                             </autoMethod>
1161
1162                             <!--IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent1_Parent.GetNumericValue() with return type of System.Int32-->
1163                             <autoMethod name="GetNumericValue" returnType="System.Int32" >
1164                                     <default>
1165                                             <int32 value="19"/>
1166                                     </default>
1167                             </autoMethod>
1168
1169                             <!--
1170                             Property NumericValue occurs in both IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent1
1171                             and IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent2. However, since the return types
1172                             are different (System.Double in IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent1, and System.Int32 in IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent2),
1173                             we can auto-implement both them, without using attribute 'declaringInterface' to separate these two implementation.
1174                             -->
1175                             <!--IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent1.NumericValue with return type of System.Double-->
1176                             <autoProperty name="NumericValue" returnType="System.Double" >
1177                                     <double value="18.2"/>
1178                             </autoProperty>
1179
1180                             <!--IMemberAmbiguityDemo_Parent2.NumericValue with return type of System.Int32-->
1181                             <autoProperty name="NumericValue" returnType="System.Int32" >
1182                                     <int32 value="14"/>
1183                             </autoProperty>
1184
1185                             <!---Auto-implementing Method with optional parameters:
1186                             int MethodWithOptionalParameters(int param1, double param2 = 3.5, int param3=7); -->
1187                             <autoMethod name="MethodWithOptionalParameters" returnType="System.Int32">
1188                                     <methodSignature>
1189                                             <int32 paramName="param1"/>
1190                                             <double paramName="param2"/>
1191                                             <int32 paramName="param3"/>
1192                                     </methodSignature>
1193                                     <if parameter1="3" parameter2="3.5" parameter3="7">
1194                                             <int32 value="17"/>
1195                                     </if>
1196                                     <default>
1197                                             <int32 value="18"/>
1198                                     </default>
1199                             </autoMethod>
1200                     </autoService>
